questions.questiontext: Which control enables you to change gear?
questions.answertext: Depressing the clutch fully enables you to change gear.

questions.questiontext: Which foot should you use to operate the footbrake?
questions.answertext: Always use the right foot to operate the footbrake. The left foot should only be used for the clutch.
The Rev counter shows engine speed in RPM. (Revolutions Per Minute)

questions.questiontext: When travelling uphill, would you need more or less gas before changing gear?
questions.answertext: Use more gas before changing gear uphill, and a quick, efficient gear change so that you don't lose momentum when the power is dis-engaged.

questions.questiontext: How should you not move the gearstick when changing gear?
questions.answertext: You should not move the gearstick angularly as this will result in gear selection mistakes.
First gear delivers most power but least speed.

questions.questiontext: What is the final part of the cockpit drill?
questions.answertext: The last part of the cockpit drill is to check and adjust the mirrors.

questions.questiontext: Which mirror shows the truer reflection?
questions.answertext: The interior mirror shows the truest reflection. The wing mirrors are convex so make things look further away.

questions.questiontext: Adjust your seating position so that you can press which pedal fully to the floor easily?
questions.answertext: Adjust your seat so that you can press the clutch pedal fully without your leg being overly stretched.

questions.questiontext: Why is it important to adjust the headrest?
questions.answertext: Adjust the headrest to protect the neck in case of an impact.

choices.text: So It Doesn't Obscure The Mirror View
